fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.session

Interface SessionHandlingStrategy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cleanable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlwaysNewSessionStrategy, BaseSessionHandlingStrategy, KeepSessionAliveStrategy, MayReuseSessionStrategy

    public interface SessionHandlingStrategy
extends Cleanable
    There exists several ways to manage SMPP session between the client and the server:
    • A new session can be created for each message (useful when message needs to be sent only sometimes)
    • A session can be reused if possible until no message has been sent for a while (useful when several messages have to be sent in a row)
    • Keep the session always alive (useful when application needs to send messages quickly and often)
    • ...
    This interface defines the entrypoints that need to be implemented to handle a session.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • getSession

        com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSession getSession()
                                     throws SmppException
        The client needs a session to be able to send the message.

        Either create a new session or use an existing one.

        Returns:
        the session
        Throws:
        SmppException - when the session can't be created (connection failure)

      • messageSent

        void messageSent(Sms sms)
          throws MessageException
        Fired when a message has been sent successfully. This entrypoint may be useful to do some cleanup or to start background tasks for example.
        Parameters:
        sms - the sent SMS
        Throws:
        MessageException - when something happens during handling of message success

      • messageNotSent

        void messageNotSent(Sms sms,
                    SmppException e)
             throws MessageException
        Fired when the message couldn't be sent due to an error. This entrypoint may be useful to do some cleanup or to start background tasks for example.
        Parameters:
        sms - the SMS that couldn't be sent
        e - the raied error while sending
        Throws:
        MessageException - when something happens during handling of message error

      • messageProcessed

        void messageProcessed(Sms sms)
        Fired when a message has been processed i.e. either when message has been sent or when an error has been raised. This entrypoint may be useful to do some cleanup or to start background tasks for example.

        This method is always called after messageSent(Sms) and messageNotSent(Sms, SmppException).

        No exception should be thrown because this is used to end the process.

        Parameters:
        sms - the sent SMS
